metadata.Title: CVE-2016-0641 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability in Oracle MySQL 5.5.47 and earlier, 5.6.28 and earlier, and 5.7.10 and earlier and MariaDB before 5.5.48, 10.0.x before 10.0.24, and 10.1.x before 10.1.12 allows local users to affect confidentiality and availability via vectors related to MyISAM.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0641` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.11-0ubuntu6
mysql-client - 5.7.11-0ubuntu6
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.11-0ubuntu6
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.11-0ubuntu6
mysql-server - 5.7.11-0ubuntu6
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.11-0ubuntu6
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.11-0ubuntu6
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.11-0ubuntu6
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.11-0ubuntu6
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.11-0ubuntu6
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.7.11-0ubuntu6').
